intro: Silene inflata var. tubiflora, commonly known as the inflated campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble small, balloon-like structures. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its unique morphology makes it a notable species in botanical studies and ecological surveys.
